name: UpdateAwsAccountIntegration
description:
Update an AWS Account Integration configuration.

Use this tool to update the configuration of an AWS Account Integration by specifying the configuration ID. Ideal for modifying existing AWS integration settings.

parameters.name: aws_account_integration_config_id
parameters.description: Unique Datadog ID for the AWS Account Integration Config. Retrieve using the List all AWS integrations endpoint and query by AWS Account ID.

value_schema.description:
Unique Datadog ID of the AWS Account Integration Config. To get the config ID for an account, use the
[List all AWS integrations](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/aws-integration/#list-all-aws-integrations) endpoint and query by AWS Account ID.

parameters.name: aws_account_update_request_data
parameters.description: JSON payload for updating AWS Account Integration. It includes detailed configurations for attributes such as account_tags, auth_config, logs_config, metrics_config, resources_config, and traces_config.

account_tags.description: Tags to apply to all hosts and metrics reporting for this account. Defaults to `[]`.

aws_partition.description:
AWS partition your AWS account is scoped to. Defaults to `aws`.
See [Partitions](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-fault-isolation-boundaries/partitions.html) in the AWS documentation for more information.

aws_regions.description: AWS Regions to collect data from. Defaults to `include_all`.

lambdas.description: List of Datadog Lambda Log Forwarder ARNs in your AWS account. Defaults to `[]`.

source.description: The AWS log source to which the tag filters defined in `tags` are applied.

tags.description: The AWS resource tags to filter on for the log source specified by `source`.

tag_filters.description: List of AWS log source tag filters. Defaults to `[]`.

sources.description:
List of service IDs set to enable automatic log collection. Discover the list of available services with the
[Get list of AWS log ready services](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/aws-logs-integration/#get-list-of-aws-log-ready-services) endpoint.

lambda_forwarder.description:
Log Autosubscription configuration for Datadog Forwarder Lambda functions. Automatically set up triggers for existing
and new logs for some services, ensuring no logs from new resources are missed and saving time spent on manual configuration.

automute_enabled.description: Enable EC2 automute for AWS metrics. Defaults to `true`.

collect_cloudwatch_alarms.description: Enable CloudWatch alarms collection. Defaults to `false`.

collect_custom_metrics.description: Enable custom metrics collection. Defaults to `false`.

enabled.description: Enable AWS metrics collection. Defaults to `true`.

namespace_filters.description: AWS Metrics namespace filters. Defaults to `exclude_only`.

namespace.description: The AWS service for which the tag filters defined in `tags` will be applied.

tags.description: The AWS resource tags to filter on for the service specified by `namespace`.

tag_filters.description: AWS Metrics collection tag filters list. Defaults to `[]`.

cloud_security_posture_management_collec.description: Enable Cloud Security Management to scan AWS resources for vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, identity risks, and compliance violations. Defaults to `false`. Requires `extended_collection` to be set to `true`.

extended_collection.description: Whether Datadog collects additional attributes and configuration information about the resources in your AWS account. Defaults to `true`. Required for `cloud_security_posture_management_collection`.

xray_services.description: AWS X-Ray services to collect traces from. Defaults to `include_only`.

attributes.description: The AWS Account Integration Config to be updated.

id.description:
Unique Datadog ID of the AWS Account Integration Config.
To get the config ID for an account, use the [List all AWS integrations](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/aws-integration/#list-all-aws-integrations)
endpoint and query by AWS Account ID.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.
